artForms.name: Madhubani Paintings
artForms.description: A vibrant folk art from Bihar, known for its intricate patterns and mythological themes.

artForms.name: Phad Paintings
artForms.description: A religious scroll painting from Rajasthan, known for its vibrant colors and depiction of epic stories.

artForms.name: Gond Art
artForms.description: A tribal art form from Madhya Pradesh, characterized by its vibrant colors and intricate patterns inspired by nature.

artForms.name: Pattachitra
artForms.description: A traditional cloth-based scroll painting from Odisha and West Bengal, known for its intricate details and mythological narratives.

artForms.name: Warli Paintings
artForms.description: A tribal art form from Maharashtra, Warli paintings depict daily life and nature using simple geometric shapes.

artForms.name: Kalamkari
artForms.description: A hand-painted or block-printed textile from Andhra Pradesh, featuring intricate designs and natural dyes.

artForms.name: Tanjore Paintings
artForms.description: A classical South Indian painting style from Tamil Nadu, known for its rich colors, surface richness, and compact composition.

artForms.name: Miniature Paintings
artForms.description: A detailed and colorful style of painting from Rajasthan and Mughal courts, often illustrating manuscripts and royal chronicles.
